document_name_accent: hoi chung loi thoat long nguc.json
subsection_content: The thoracic outlet includes the space from the supraclavicular fossa to the axillary fossa. This space is formed by the top ribs, just below the collarbone. TOS occurs when nerves or blood vessels are compressed by the ribs, collarbone, or neck muscles at the exit end. A collection of ill-defined disorders characterized by pain and paresthesias in the hands, neck, shoulders, or arms. They involve compression of the brachial plexus (and possibly the supraclavicular vessels) as these structures pass through the thoracic outlet. (first)
subsection_title: hoi chung loi thoat long nguc.json. What is Thoracic Outlet Syndrome (TOS)?
subsection_data:
hoi chung loi thoat long nguc.json. What is Thoracic Outlet Syndrome (TOS)?
The thoracic outlet includes the space from the supraclavicular fossa to the axillary fossa. This space is formed by the top ribs, just below the collarbone. TOS occurs when nerves or blood vessels are compressed by the ribs, collarbone, or neck muscles at the exit end. A collection of ill-defined disorders characterized by pain and paresthesias in the hands, neck, shoulders, or arms. They involve compression of the brachial plexus (and possibly the supraclavicular vessels) as these structures pass through the thoracic outlet. (first)
